Name: Weighted Petri Net
Definition: The net is correctly formed (no inhibitor arcs).

Name: Unit Weighted
Definition: All input and output arcs weight 1.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: State Machine
Definition: Each transition has exactly one input arc and one output arc.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Marked Graph
Definition: Each place has exactly one input arc and one output arc.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Join Free
Definition: Each transition has exactly one input arc.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Choice Free
Definition: No shared place, each place has at most one output arc.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Fork Attribution
Definition: A Join Free and Choice Free net.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Equal Conflict
Definition: Homogeneous Free Choice Net.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Free Choice
Definition: If two transitions have at least one shared input places, they have no other input places.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Restricted FC
Definition: A Free-Choice net in which every place  holds post(p)>1 => pre(post(p))=p
References: Joachim Wehler, Free-Choice Petri Nets without frozen tokens and Bipolar Synchronization Systems, https://arxiv.org/abs/cs/0609095

Name: Asymmetric Choice
Definition: if two places have common input transitions then the set of input transitions of the one is a subset of the set of input transitions of the other.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Safe
Definition: The amount of tokens in each place is bounded by 1.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: Bounded
Definition: The amount of tokens in each place is bounded.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: K-Bounded
Definition: The amount of tokens in each place is bounded by K.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: K-Marking
Definition: The initial marking of each place is a multiple of k.
References: Llorens, Marisa & Oliver, Javier & Silva, Josep & Tamarit, Salvador. (2017). An Integrated Environment for Petri Net Slicing. 112-124. 10.1007/978-3-319-57861-3_8.  https://www.researchgate.net/publication/316702639_An_Integrated_Environment_for_Petri_Net_Slicing

Name: Pure
Definition: The net has no self loop.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: NP-Simple-Side-Cond
Definition: The net can contain self loop only with weights of 1.
References: Reference missing.

Name: Reversible
Definition: There is a home marking reachable from all markings reached from the intinial marking.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: Homogeneous
Definition: For each place p, all output weights of p are equal.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Strongly Connected
Definition: There is a path from each place to every other place.
References: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Connectivity_(graph_theory)

Name: Weakly Connected
Definition: There is a path from each place to every other place considering the graph non oriented.
References: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Connectivity_(graph_theory)

Name: Isolated Elements
Definition: There is an element with no input or output.

Name: Well Connected
Definition: Every place and transition has at least one input.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Well Formed
Definition: Structuraly live and structurally bounded.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Structurally Live
Definition: A marking M exists such that the net is live.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Structurally Bounded
Definition: The system is bounded for each initial marking.
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Strongly Live
Definition: For every reachable marking, for each transition, there exists a firing sequence after which the transition is enable.
References: Llorens, Marisa & Oliver, Javier & Silva, Josep & Tamarit, Salvador. (2017). An Integrated Environment for Petri Net Slicing. 112-124. 10.1007/978-3-319-57861-3_8.  https://www.researchgate.net/publication/316702639_An_Integrated_Environment_for_Petri_Net_Slicing

Name: Weakly Live
Definition: There is no reachable dead marking.
References: Llorens, Marisa & Oliver, Javier & Silva, Josep & Tamarit, Salvador. (2017). An Integrated Environment for Petri Net Slicing. 112-124. 10.1007/978-3-319-57861-3_8.  https://www.researchgate.net/publication/316702639_An_Integrated_Environment_for_Petri_Net_Slicing

Name: Simply Lve
Definition: Each transition can be fired at least once.
References: Llorens, Marisa & Oliver, Javier & Silva, Josep & Tamarit, Salvador. (2017). An Integrated Environment for Petri Net Slicing. 112-124. 10.1007/978-3-319-57861-3_8.  https://www.researchgate.net/publication/316702639_An_Integrated_Environment_for_Petri_Net_Slicing

Name: Persistent
Definition: From each reachable marking, no transition firing can disable any other transition.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: Backward Persistent
References: Raymond Devillers, Thomas Hujsa. Analysis and Synthesis of Weighted Marked Graph Petri Nets:Exact and Approximate Methods. Fundamenta Informaticae, Polskie Towarzystwo Matematyczne,2019, 169 (1-2), pp.1 - 30.  10.3233/FI-2019-1837. hal-02332309

Name: Forward Conflict Free
Definition: Each place has at most one output arc.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: Backward Conflict Free
Definition: Each place has at most one input arc.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: Binary Conflict Free
Definition: In every reachable marking,  for any enabled pair of transitions, there are enough tokens for both transitions.
References: Llorens, Marisa & Oliver, Javier & Silva, Josep & Tamarit, Salvador. (2017). An Integrated Environment for Petri Net Slicing. 112-124. 10.1007/978-3-319-57861-3_8.  https://www.researchgate.net/publication/316702639_An_Integrated_Environment_for_Petri_Net_Slicing

Name: Non decreasing
Definition: The token content of any directed circuit in the net is never decreased by transition firing.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: Increasing
Definition: The token content of any directed circuit in the net is never increased transition firing.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: Circuit
Definition: Each node has exactly one input and one output.
References: Reference missing.

Name: Siphon Circuit
Definition: The set of places in every directed circuit is a syphon.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: Trap Circuit
Definition: The set of places in every directed circuit is a trap.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: Siphon Circuit Contained
Definition: The set of places in every directed circuit contains a syphon.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: Trap Circuit Contained
Definition: The set of places in every directed circuit contains a trap.
References: T. Murata, Petri nets: Properties, analysis and applications, in Proceedings of the IEEE, vol. 77, no. 4, pp. 541-580, April 1989, doi: 10.1109/5.24143.

Name: Consistent
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Conservative
References: Thomas Hujsa. Contribution to the study of weighted Petri nets. Modeling and Simulation. UniversitéPierre et Marie Curie - Paris VI, 2014. English. <NNT: 2014PA066342>. <tel-01127406> http://thomas-hujsa.fr/images/PDF/Thesis-Hujsa.pdf

Name: Homogeneous with K shared place
Definition: Homogeneous net with at most k shared places.
References: Hujsa, Thomas & Berthomieu, Bernard & Dal Zilio, Silvano & Botlan, Didier. (2020). On the Petri Nets with a Single Shared Place and Beyond. https://arxiv.org/abs/2005.04818

Name: Homogeneous with 1 shared place
Definition: Homogeneous net with at most 1 shared place.
References: Hujsa, Thomas & Berthomieu, Bernard & Dal Zilio, Silvano & Botlan, Didier. (2020). On the Petri Nets with a Single Shared Place and Beyond. https://arxiv.org/abs/2005.04818

Name: HCF
Definition: Homogeneous subclass of Choice-Free nets

Name: Directed
Definition: Every two potentially reachabe markings have a common reachable marking.

Name: Initially Directed
Definition: Every potentially reachable marking and the initial marking have a common reachable marking.

Name: Transition name
Definition: Outputs
